content.description: Crap--Fingers in a corner. Lots of bird crap in the bottom, crap rock going up. FA bailed off of one pin and nut. Dont do this one.
content.protection: See above.
content.location: A nice looking corner thirty or so feet down from the Loctite series of climbs;

content.description: The thin, clean open book left of Capulin Classic. The corner starts at tiny wires and gradually opens to .4 camalots at the hanging roof. Bouldery moves through the roof take you to a no-hands ledge. Clip a long LA and follow the left seam/crack through two more bulging cruxes. A spectacular trad route.
content.protection: Small wires, (2ea) .1-.2 (3ea) .3-.4 (1ea) .5-1 (opt.) #4 for final moves to rim or TR directional
content.location: Left of Capulin Classic. Climb up the OW to the sloping ramp to a two-bolt belay for the corner. 70m rope only barely reaches with stretch from anchors above the right exit back to the base of the corner. Knot your Rope!!

content.description: This route stacks up against the best anywhere and it will challenge every one of your crack climbing skills. Had a huge bridge/block spanning the chimney; the Widomaker.  The many-ton Widowmaker block fell out of the chimney in the winter of 10/11. Head up towards the big roof; step left and clip two bolts, climbing on the arête. Tip into the corner. Tips to fingers to hands to a fist crack to the roof.  Over the roof a 20 ft 6 crack takes you to the anchors.
content.protection: Single set TCUs 0.1 to 0.5.  2 each .75, 3 each #1-3. Optional #4 and #6 (the 6 portion of the crack is about 5.9 but there's a slight chance you'll be tired by this point).  Long slings needed to control drag.
content.location: Look for the unmistakable huge chimney with the 15 foot roof at the top.

content.description: Start behind the free standing tower. Hard move off the ground to very fun climbing in a stemming slot. Fun, but a little weird in the offwidth up high.  Gear belay. Rap from Gauntlet anchors with 2 ropes.
content.protection: Doubles to #3, 1 #5 new Camalot for the very top.
content.location: Directly behind Red Tail Tower. Goes right of the huge scary looking roof.

content.description: Tips & fingers in a beautiful left-facing corner, to & thru a small roof.
content.protection: 5-6 (or more) #0.2/green C3s/black totems/purple metolius etc.; 1-2 ea. #0.3 to #0.75, 1 #1.PG13 because tips cams, from the start, for a ways.
content.location: Dihedral left of the History Lessons alcove.  Starts on a boulder.

content.description: Whole lota fun! A nice finger crack leads to a hands slot on the right side of a flake.  More fingers/hands above through a couple of small features leads to a ledge. May want to belay from the ledge to reduce rope drag. Above, a 70ft thin hands to wide hands crack takes you to the anchors.
content.protection: Doubles from green aliens to #2s, 3#3. Set of nuts, slings.
content.location: Left of Widowmaker.

content.description:
Thin and varied climbing off the ground leads to a big ledge. Belay here or head on up the overhanging finger crack to the thin hands crack above.

 Last OW pitch to the top of the cliff is 5.11, #5s & #6s, no anchor, big loose blocks and quite a bit of questionable rock. Best to rap (2x with a 60) from here.
content.protection: Triples in 0 through 0.75, 2 #1, 1 #2, 1#3. Extra gray Alien, purple TCUs might be useful. Optional belay at intermediate anchor or do two shorter pitches. Protects and climbs much better than it looks from the ground. 2 raps with a single rope.

content.description: Goes to the Dark Crystal anchors.
content.protection: Standard rack.
content.location: Just right of Dark Crystal.

content.description: P1 not so fun, 10+, dirty to a ledge with a burned(?) tree. P2 is outstanding, 10+, fingers to hands. Rappel in from Slotterhouse to climb just the 2nd pitch. Rap route #12 (2 raps with a 60m rope).
content.protection: Standard rack, nuts.
content.location: See overview topo.

content.description: No anchors. Could be fun but loaded with loose blocks.
content.protection: Standard rack.
content.location: On the very right hand side of the big wall that holds Rufie and Monster. See overview topo.

content.description: The first part is 10ish, only OK.
content.protection: Standard rack plus extra #3s, #4s for the top.
content.location: Up broken up cracks to the left of Hallucinogen Roof

content.description:
Climbs a cool pocketed face to a ledge mid-way up with some loose rock (optional belay).  Steep corner to an exciting traverse, ending at the big burned tree . Rap off the burned tree (bring webbing).  

  Checking for Chipmunks. Left variation, 5.10R; to the roof, LB over, head to Treehugger tree. Wider than #6.
content.protection: Standard rack to #3, set of nuts.
content.location: See overview topo.

content.description:
Great movement up a nice finger to tips dihedral.

 There is an extension from this anchor that has yet to be climbed through to the Endgame ledge, will go at 12+ or 13- I presume.
content.protection: Camalots   (2) .3 to 1   Optional red C3
content.location: Far right side of the Main Cliff.  Just right of Less Than Zero.     Bolted Chain Anchor

content.description: Obvious slot. A tasty and relatively easy meal to start the wall with. Has a pin at the start.
content.protection: 3 each #75 and #1.
content.location: All the way at end of the first wall, just before the break between the two walls.

content.description: Because its Classic Rock, man!  200ft (knot your ropes). Fun hands to wide to the top of a pillar, layback up the super steep fingers crack on the left, step right into the clean ramp/dihedral, climb a featured 0.75 corner with bird crap coming out of it to a OW section that can be protected with small gear on the left (0 & RPs) to fingers through two roofs.
content.protection: Doubles in 0, green alien, Camalots: triples (or more) in grey to gold, 1 Camalot #4. Nuts.
content.location: Easiest to spot the splitter crack up high and look down for the start. 40 feet canyon from the more obvious Hellbender start.

content.description: Pretty fun thin hands. The blocks you climb over look pretty scary but seemed OK when pried on and jumped on.
content.protection: #1 to #3, a few smaller pieces.
content.location: Just to the right of the Monkey Spank corner.

content.description: Clean, fun climbing up an obvious V slot. Both pitches are about 95 ft. Small (a bit tricky) gear protects the back of the flare on P1. A 6 might be useful for the very top of 2nd pitch.  2 rappels with a 60m rope.
content.protection: Standard rack with an extra hand size and an optional six for a pretty easy wide section at the very top.

climbs.name: Simian Sunshine
climbs.fa: A. Miller with D. Berisford and E. Swanson

content.description: A fun, short hand crack that widens with height. Sure to become the standard warmup in this sector. Worth doing!
content.protection: Single rack, #2-#5.  An extra #2 maybe.
content.location: The perfectly-cut hands corner just right of History Lessons.

content.description: P15.11-, 115ft, **, P25.10+, 80 *. P1- Right-facing corner to a small roof.  No anchor at the top of the cliff. Rap Classic or Widowmaker.
content.protection: 2 ea. cams up to a #4.   P2 up into OW.

content.description: This ones a knockout. Up the right side of the big tower, aiming for the series of roofs.
content.protection: Doubles to #2, extra .4 to .75, nuts. Extra red, gold.
content.location: Locate the huge corner in the middle of this wall; Rufie goes up the left side of this feature through the obvious roofs.

climbs.name: Rue Morgue Avenue
climbs.fa: Josh Smith, Matt Balkey, George Perkins

content.description: Rue Morgue Avenue is a complex route. P1 95ft, 5.11. P2 is 110ft going to the left up the big chimney, 5.11.  P2a is 110 ft going right up the big chimney from the belay (5.12ish around the obvious roof).  P1. Start up the finger crack that splits the face directly below the huge roof.  When finger crack ends, climb blocky steep thin cracks to the large ledgelook for a pin to the right of the dihedral about 80 feet up. The rock gets better as the climb goes along.  P2. Climb the hand crack through the roof just left of the belay, aiming for the left side of the roof. Climb fat hands to the roof, traverse left on good holds; exit up to an easy groove.   P2a. Step right, climb the finger crack to the OW to the roof. Hard moves past the roof, clip a pin, jugs to fingers to hands.
content.protection: P1: 2-3 each from 0-#1. Set nuts; RPs useful.   P2: 2# 1s, 3 #2s, 3-4 #3s, a few #0.5 to #0.75 cams can protect the roof traverse.   P2a: Doubles fingers to #3,  1-#5 for the OW. A purple TCU can protect  before the pin.
content.location: The roof is pretty easy to spot. It's huge, about two hundred feet up from the end of the cliff.

content.description:
An easy introduction to the route leads to a big ledge. Clip a bolt off the ledge, pull some hard moves, and don't plan on any rests until you clip the anchor. Fierce and sustained.  

  A second pitch can be done by someone with tiny fingers,an iron will, and a disregard for gravity.
content.protection: 5.12 fingers/tips. Rack; 1 each 0 - .3, 2 each .4 , 3 3 each .5 - .75. 1 #1,  2 each #2. One quick draw.
content.location: Ten feet to the left of Pinch Point; see overview topo.

content.description: There is one distinct and somewhat puzzling crux but the moves aren't that bad once you solve the sequence. A few easier puzzles present themselves at other points in the route as well and keep the climbing entertaining and high quality until you get to the anchor. Comparable to History Lesson in difficulty and more technical than powerful throughout.
content.protection: Doubles from #0.1 to #0.75, a #2 to protect the first fifteen feet before moving left (possible to place another #2 up higher if you want it). Set of nuts and slings. Two bolts and a pin at the very top. There is a fixed nut below the pin--please leave it there as clipping it could prevent a ledge fall.
content.location: Just right of the Widowmaker chimney, shares the first fifteen feet of Blockhead and breaks left on a ramp (look for a bolt).

climbs.name: Pretty Fly for a White Guy

content.description: Get out your sticky fly feet. Crux is sustained tips/stemming off the pillar near the bottom leads to excellent 5.11 climbing.
content.protection: Many tips to fingers pieces in a stemming dihedral, lots of fat fingers/thin hands to follow.
content.location: Obvious clean dihedral that goes all the way to the top of the cliff, near where the trail hits the cliff.

content.description: Went to a big tree, which has burned.  No anchor.
content.protection: Singles, doubles in 0.75-#2
content.location: Look for the big burned tree.

content.description: Super cool thin hands to fingers laybacking. A bit of spicy movement over a pin up near the top 2 raps climbers left with a single rope.
content.protection: 1-00, 3-0, Triples in yellow Alien through 0.75. 4#1, 2 #2s, 1 #3 (save for top, just past the knife blade). You can get an OK yellow or grey Alien in a pocket, below the knife blade.
content.location: Just left of the broken up section in the cliff, down canyon from where the trail hits. The pinched off upper dihedral is visible from the ground.

content.description:
5.8 hands climbing to the ledge with the anchor of Classic. Cross the ramp and up the finger crack to the roof, step left, mantle, & climb more fingers/tips to the Vicar anchors. Fun stuff, but you want to be on your toes at a couple of points; both crossing the ramp and topping out the dihedral. . See               

Capulin Classic area.       under Capulin Classic.
content.protection: riples/quads in 0 to 0.5, nuts, 1 #1 Camalot. May want a #3 for the last fifteen feet.
content.location: Start 30 down from the OW start to Classic & Vicar.

content.description: A fun and varied climb up to an obvious dihedral that appears to (and in fact does) pinch off completely.
content.protection: Doubles to #2, set of nuts. Extra slings to control drag. May want extra 00 and 0. One quick draw.
content.location: Shares anchor with Pussy Riot.

content.description: P1 is a bit crappy (5.10);  Start behind the tower, clip two bolts (currently no hangerspulled because this is a bit of a dodgy lead) and head up towards the white dihedral left of the roof. Belay on the ledge just left of the roof.Circum pitch 1 is a better choice to start, and if you use the Circum start, the route is three stars. P2. Head up the splitter and enter a huge chimney. A nice OW splits the left wall.   George, Josh
content.protection: Two new style fours (or old 3.5s), a 5, and a 6 useful for the OW. Otherwise, a rack of doubles to #3 and some nuts.
content.location: Start behind Red Tail Tower.

content.description: A short 5.6 pitch puts you below the obvious corner. Fingers/hands, to wide hands to a good rest below a roof/slot.  Fingers through the strenuous roof to a crappy stance, then clip a fixed pin (a good Simond thats buried six inches in the crack) and pull some very thin moves to a jug and the anchor. Very fun climbing, and harder than it looks all the way up.
content.protection: Doubles from green Alien to #3 Camalot, nuts.
content.location: Two lines left of Classic.

climbs.name: Physical
climbs.fa: Josh Smith, George Perkins, Calita Quesada

content.description: P1: A bit of physical laybacking needed. Very nice thin hands to some wide climbing.  P2. 70ft.  Fingers, thin hands to a very nice ledge. Excellent 5.10 pitch.  If you're doing P2, best to take a second rope and rap all the way down.
content.protection: P1: #1s to #4 new style Camalot. P2: fingers to thin hands.
content.location: The first big corner you get to walking down canyon from where the trail hits the cliff.

climbs.name: Perk Up
climbs.fa: George Perkins, Josh Smith, Mark Wolfenden

content.description: Left-facing corner to a height-dependent crux. Easy to rap off the end of a single 60 and downclimb.
content.protection: Mostly 3s with a variety of smaller stuff.

content.description: Very fun wide climbing. Rap from upper ledge.
content.protection: Single rack, #5, #6.
content.location: Offwidth just down from where the trail hits the cliff, twenty feet from Squoze.

content.description: P1: Easy 5.8 featured climbing to the large ledge.  Small trees have burned, so no anchor to come down after just p1. Move belay right on the slab to the base of a long OW.  P2: Lieback the OW up past scary pillar, step right on the ledge and finish on a finger crack to a burned tree.
content.protection: Standard rack w/ #4, #5, #6 camalot

content.description: Short but fun. Fierce fingers to a delicate move protected by small gear.
content.protection: Tips to fingers sizes. 0 or small nut size for the slot. Nuts useful.
content.location: Head for the finger crack that terminates below the huge corner in the middle of this wall. See overview topo.

content.description: Tips laybacking up a beautiful corner to thin hands. Monkey up!
content.location: Just down from where the trail hits the cliff. Look for the little alcove with the pretty black corner.

climbs.name: Monkey Business
climbs.fa: A. Miller with some combination of effort by W. Vining, G. Perkins and J. Smith

content.description:
A super fun route with some variety. Start with a piece low in flakes to get to a bolt out right (flakes are flexy up high, therefore the bolt). Stand up in pod to reach splitter hands to a ledge. Interesting and wild moves up a tips corner to a ledge stance where you can clip an anchor.  

  This was originally considered a dirty 40’ toprope at 5.10 in early ascents by J. Smith and others.  The addition of 25’ of good interesting climbing with a super fun crux move makes it worthy as its own. 

  An extension past first anchor to the upper anchor (Serious Monkey Business??) has yet to be sent, and may be still red tagged by one of the FA party. This will be at least 12+ but likely harder, if possible (can people climb purple C3s?)
content.protection: single rack from green C3 (purple TCU) to red Camalot. An extra #1 and .3 helpful.
content.location: Just left of dark corner route Monkey Spank. Look for bolt 15' off ground.

content.description: P1: 5.11+, 80ft. P2: 5.11, 110ft. P1 is beautiful tips corner to bolted anchor. P2 is thin hands, hands, then wide, to a nice finger crack finish, no anchor.
content.protection: P1: 2-3 each green aliens to #1 Camalot.P2: #1s through #4.
content.location: Starts about ten feet up from the base of the wall. The corner is very striking and obvious.

content.description:
Lightning Road follows the obvious splitter on the right hand face of the Hellbender dihedral. The crack appears to terminate partway up the west face of the dihedral, but in fact it keeps going to a ledge. Important! The route is 215 feet to the ground. If you have a 60M rope, scramble to the large ledge up about 15 feet and belay from there (4th class).  

  From the ledge, you can climb the left Hellbender start (10+ fingers) or the right start, which is a 5.7 handcrack. Both go to the base of the lightning bolt crack. Follow the crack through a small roof and past a pin to where it terminates on a ledge. This section is the crux and involves steep fingers, then some delicate arete pinching/climbing while placing gear and clipping the pin on the left. Step right, clip another pin, then climb up past another pin and a small roof to a thin hands crack to the top of the cliff. This route is every bit as good as Hellbender but a number grade hard at least (may feel a tad harder than 12- and a bit more adventuresome than some of the other 12s at Capulin).
content.protection: (2) each #0.2 and 0.3, (3 to 5) each 0.4 - #1, (1) #2 for the top, set of nuts, heavy on the small to medium nuts. Many runners to control drag (critical).  The pins are very good long Lost Arrows.
content.location: Same start as for Hellbender. It is exactly 200 feet from the big ledge 15 feet up to the top--be careful! The route is the first one up canyon from the Red Tail Tower alcove. See beta photo.

climbs.name: Less Than Zero
climbs.fa: Josh Smith, George Perkins, Mark Wolfenden

content.description: Face climbing to delicate stemming to slightly overhanging hands/wide hands up a stretch of terrific rock. Incredible route--Climbing doesn't get much better than this.
content.protection: Two bolts start the bottom, then into a purple TCU seam on the left. Doubles of double zero through #3 Camalots. Small nuts and a couple of the larger RPs useful.
content.location: The big blank face at the end of the cliff is split by a magnetic crack that terminates 3/4 of the way up the cliff. Go there and go up.

content.description: A honey of a route. Fingers onto a ramp, up to the clean dihedral (just left of the big corner). More fingers and difficult climbing leads to a beautiful 5.10 ramp.
content.protection: Single set of tips, doubles in 0.5 #2. Might want an extra green alien.
content.location: See overview topo. Look for the big corner in the middle of this wall, then look left for the tight corner above the ramp.

content.description: Top rope wide crack on right side of the Holloween flake.
content.protection: TR from Holloween. Wider than sixes and pretty easy.
content.location: Right side of the Holloween pillar.

content.description: Fun but a little spooky. Hands to OW & back to hands up a very prominent flake.
content.protection: Golds & blues. 2 new style #4 Camalots. 1 5 & 1 6 useful. A couple of fingers & hand size pieces for the top.
content.location: Look for the big pillar leaning up against the wall with a crack on either side.

content.description: Very, very cool. Fingers to a stance, then very thin face moves up a dihedral protected by micronuts.  Originally stopped about 50 feet up. Later pushed up through the thin dihedral.
content.protection: Initally had two fixed Simond pins at the low stance. 2 #0 (purple TCU), 3-4 Gray and purple Camalot sizes, one #2 Camalot useful for the hands section, possible to place a #0.75 in the pocket in the dihedral up top. One quickdraw.
content.location: Look for the finger crack up the arete, right near where the trail hits the cliff, down canyon from Red Tail Tower.

content.description: P1 is 5.11-, 90, P2 is 5.10, 75ft. Climb the clean dihedral, placing an excellent small nut and clipping a bolt and getting good finger-size gear above. Belay on the slab at anchors. Climb the finger/hand crack to the roof.
content.protection: Singles to 075, doubles in #1-2.  One quickdraw.
content.location: Start directly below the big roof.

content.description: Fingers to fat fingers to thin hands to a very short OW at the top. FA occurred in a rainstorm, and fingers liebacking on wet rock is a lot like trying to hold on to a hellbender.
content.protection: Triple rack from green alien to #1s (red Camalot). One #2, optional #3 & #4. Extra 0.5 - 0.75 if desired.
content.location: About 150 feet up canyon from Red Tail Tower; look for the obvious big corner that starts with a finger crack up the left side of a flake. See beta photo.

content.description: Throw down or runyour choice. Thin moves to a bit of crimpy face climbing. The rock at the start is better than it looks (but only just). The crux is protected by a bolt. The finger crack on the headwall above the anchor was aided but remains unsentsmall gear on dubious rock.
content.protection: Doubles from 0 to #2s. A #3 is nice as the first piece, and two extra reds for the hand crack might be useful. Possible to place a #3 at the very top. Nuts optional.
content.location: Go up behind Red Tail Tower on the down canyon side. Gauntlet is behind the big tree.

content.description: Some ramps lead to a prominent hand crack in a corner to a nice finish. Will always have some loose rock on it. No anchor, rap Widowmaker.
content.protection: Doubles to #2, 1-#3, 1 #4, nuts. Slings to control drag.
content.location: Look for the short hand crack up high.

content.description:
Climb the finger crack that splits the right wallgoes from fingers to tight hands.  

  Bonus climb: Straight up Widowmaker. TR problem.  Do a full body bridge up the chimney until you can get in the crack in the corner.
content.protection: Rack: 2 each 0.5 & 0.75. Minimum of three each #1, #2.
content.location: Splits the right wall of the Widowmaker chimney.

content.protection: Requires a variety of gear from 0.2 on up. Need green aliens and nuts for the top part.
content.location: Just right of the obvious high ramp corner of Pinch Point.

content.description: Offwidth just right of Blockhead. Wide climbing leads to body width climbing to a ledge.
content.protection: Done by with 1 #4, 5, 6, plus a variety of smaller stuff.
content.location: Just right of Blockhead; shares anchor.

content.description: A very clean line with some interesting climbing. There is no gear immediately off the ground, but a couple of 5.10 moves led to a good stance and good gear. A bit of technical climbing leads to some face holds and a nice ledge with an anchor. Shorter than the average for the main cliff but a very nice addition.
content.protection: A selectin of #0.2-#0.75 works fine. One #2.
content.location: This is the clean shallow corner about 100 feet down the cliff from Red Tail Tower and Gauntlet.

content.description: P1 is 5.10, 115 ft. P2 is 5.11+, 100 ft. P2 is fingers/tips to a 5-6" overhanging crack. The tips section is the crux. (Hint, face climb on the arête around the tiny roof). The OW is 10- because of copious face holds. Possible to rap twice with a full length 60 (2nd rap to ledge on left), but knot your rope on both raps.
content.protection: P1: Hands & fingers. P1. Singles in finger sizes, Set TCUs, doubles in 0.75 to #2, 1#3, 1#4. Extra 1,2 if desired. Bolt anchor at top of pitch.P2: 2-#0, 3-green Aliens, singles & small nuts to #2, 1 or 2 each #5 and #6.
content.location: Last route on this side.

content.description:
P1 is 50 feet and ends on the Classic ledge; start from the Classic OW or the 5.8 just down canyon. Fun hands/wide hands with a hidden bit of OW near the top. See               

Capulin Classic area.       under Capulin Classic.
content.protection: Doubles in 0.5 - #3. #5 useful but not required, nuts. Save a couple of finger pieces for the last fifteen feet.
content.location: Can start up the Classic OW or the 5.8 just down canyon.

content.description:
2 pitches. P1, start up the thin finger crack 20 feet up canyon from the Red Tail Tower. Step left into the dihedral, up the face crack and reach right at the small roof, make a big move right to gain the anchor shared by Perkolator (single 11ish move).  P2. Climb P2 of Perkolator-- through a 10+ roof, up nice cracks to a huge chimney, up the 5.9 off-width on the left side of the chimney. 

  This is a very fun way to the top of the cliff at a moderate grade.
content.protection: Doubles/triples in finger sizes through hand sizes, #4, #5, #6 for the wider stuff up high.
content.location: Walk around Red Tail Tower and look for the short finger crack just a few feet up canyon from it.

content.description:
Must have been climbed at some point; this is almost the definition of a classic climb. 

  Optional belay at 50ft on a nice ledge (belaying here reduces rope drag). Sweet 10- OW to the big ledge, then hands to thin hands forever. Pinches down to fingers and then tips right near the top.
content.protection: Doubles from grey camalot to green Camalot. 3 or 4 reds, 3 golds, 1 blue, 1#6, #5 optional, nuts optional. Maybe take a green alien.
content.location: Look for the most obvious crack up canyon from Red Tail Tower (see overview topo).

content.description: Look for the neat obsidian nodule at ankle level just off the trail at the base of the route.
content.protection: #2s and #3s, a few large finger size pieces for the very start and the very top.
content.location: Just to the right of the clean tips corner (Loctite) an obvious hand crack splits the face and goes to a ledge.

content.description: This is likely one of the best 5.10 finger cracks in Capulin. It's sustained, protects well, and has enjoyable climbing for the entire route.
content.protection: 2-3 each #0.2-#2, set nuts. Maybe a few extra #0.5. Most of the route is fingers, but there are plenty of places for smaller and larger gear.
content.location: Start about ten feet right of the obvious pillar that marks the start of Pretty Fly.

content.description: Starts up a nice 5.9 hand crack to a ledge, then a stretch of slightly awkward 5.10 to the anchors.
content.protection: Singles to 0.5, doubles 0.75 to 2.0. Extra 1 and 2 might be useful.
content.location: First route to the right of Widomaker.

pathTokens: Capulin Canyon and Cochiti Mesa Area Crags

content.description:
The main cliff is the first one above the Bandelier boundary. See the approach map on the main Capulin page. The main cliff has the majority of the longer routes--some are 200 foot single pitches. Two ropes are a good idea, though it's possible to spend a nice day there on the shorter routes.  

  Many of these routes have only been climbed once. Expect loose rock and some dirt.
